before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"7d9u9","text":"During RT-qPCR preparation, it is important to avoid DNA cross-contamination. Use an area exclusively for RNA work.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"doa6v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"28vlp","text":"Clean the working area and all equipment with 10% bleach. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fabd3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5t9q1","text":"Dispose of contaminated sharps and waste appropriately ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"33ls3","text":"This protocol is for dried blood spot (DBS) sample collection, the extraction of viral RNA from dried blood spots, and the following RT-qPCR setup for the detection of Dengue, Chikungunya, and Zika viruses.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fjumu","text":"1. Use the paper puncher to punch a 6-mm punch in the dried blood spot. Sterilize the paper puncher with fire and make a clean punch after each use to avoid cross-contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"o8nl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3ev1c","text":"2.  Extract Viral RNA utilizing the QIAamp Viral RNA Mini Kit according to the manufacturer's instructions..","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":25}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"1013DF0841214FB4958922B96E113A64","url":"https://www.protocols.io/reagents/qiagen/qiaampviralrnaminikit-125986"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"86j6b","text":"3. Prepare the RT-qPCR master mix using the Quantinova SYBR Green RT-PCR Kit for the three arboviruses. Three final volumes of 25 µl of PCR mixes contained 5 µL of RNA extract with individual DENV, CHIKV, or ZIKV primer pairs at a concentration of 0.3 µM, 0.3 µM, and 0.4 µM, respectively. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":28}],"data":[]},{"key":"f3js9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fnft2","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"60phq","text":" Primers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"60ola","text":"  ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":2}],"data":[]},{"key":"avmdb","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dmua5","text":"Master Mix ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dpacf","text":"               Dengue   Chikungunya Zika     Master Mix µL Master Mix µL Master Mix µL   RNA Sample 5 RNA Sample 5 RNA Sample 5   ddH20 3.75 ddH20 4.5 ddH20 4   SYBR green 12.5 SYBR green 12.5 SYBR green 12.5   RT Mix 0.25 RT Mix 0.25 RT Mix 0.25   Primer-F (0.3 µM) 0.75 Primer-F (0.3 µM) 0.75 Primer-F (0.4 µM)) 1   Primer-R1 (0.3 µM) 0.75 Primer-R (0.3 µM) 0.75 Primer-R (0.4 µM) 1   Primer-R2 (0.3 µM) 0.75 Rox 1.25 Rox 1.25   Rox 1.25           Total 25   25   25  ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":133,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":144,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":154,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":470}],"data":[]},{"key":"854d9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a0cvc","text":"4. Process the RT-qPCR in the Applied Biosystems StepOnePlus™ Real-Time PCR System with the following conditions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"15dds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aetkk","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"acjbc","text":"    1.   RT ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":12}],"data":[]},{"key":"7ge9c","text":"5. A sample was considered positive if the fluorescence curve crossed the threshold line within 40 cycles (Cq\u003c40); and if the melting curve for DENV was around 80.25°C for DENV-1, 81.75°C for DENV-2, 80.,5°C for DENV-3 and DENV-4 for 83°C, for CHIKV and ZIKV was between 81°C and 82°C. Send positive samples for {"blocks":[{"key":"29q87","text":"1.  Wear gloves and label the filter paper to be used before collecting DBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"erc86","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"drm1d","text":"2.  Clean the finger from which sample will be collected with  75% alcohol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"99dcg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f8229","text":"3.  Fingerprick with a small lancet after alcohol dries off. Apply gentle pressure to the finger and allow a large drop of  to collect at the puncture site. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e0niv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"42ie9","text":"4. Remember NOT to press the filter paper against the puncture wound, rather allow the blood to drop and saturate the full circle. Avoid smering the blood spot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1fcd2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7d19k","text":"5.  After the blood spots are completely on the filter paper, allow it to dry before placing it in a sealed plastic bag.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fkeh5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bij7b","text":"6.  Store the  filter paper in the sealed plastic bag with a desiccant package and then store it in closed box. Avoid exposure to the sun.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
